intro: Mortoniodendron ocotense, commonly known as the Ocoteno tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico, Guatemala, and Honduras. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
